entries.waypoint_description_1: A band of Wittin's Jawa Enforcers hunting Kitster Banai.
entries.next: I don't have anything else for you to do right now. If something comes up later, I'll let you know.
entries.npc_smuggle_5: Smooth! You got the data? Thanks. This weather out here was about to repave my exterior. I gotta get this onto the 'Net, thanks.
entries.player_sorry_5: I don't know.  Once I give it to him, I'll let you know.
entries.player_reset_5: I haven't killed anything for a while.  I'm dropping this job so I can blow up things.
entries.player_reset_4: I've changed my mind.  I don't want to help you anymore.
entries.player_2_5: I didn't hear anything about killing in there.  No, I'm not interested.
entries.player_2_4: No thanks.  If I can't kill something, I'm not interested.
entries.player_1_5: Oh, I like clever plans!  Sure, I'll do it.
entries.npc_work_5: So, was Thermal able to get this rolling?
entries.npc_work_4: Is Krin alright?  Where is she?
entries.npc_takeme_4: I had no idea Drik Bandrik was arranging a frame. As soon as I found out, I rushed back here. Please take me to Kitster!
entries.npc_reward_5: Great job! Thermal sent proof of Drik Bandrik's fraud straight to Jabba the Hutt. Jabba won't like it that Drik played him like a dejarik piece. I expect Drik will find it healthy to visit another world soon. Thanks for all your invaluable help, I'm in your debt.
entries.npc_reward_4: Thank you! Krin and I will see to it that Drik Bandrik goes to prison for this -- or worse. Hmm, I may need your services again though.
entries.npc_reset_5: Oh, bad! I can practically taste my freedom. I'll have to find someone else to make this delivery. Thanks anyway.
entries.npc_reset_4: Well, I hope Krin can find her way here alone. She's getting on in years, and the desert is pretty tough.
entries.npc_breech_5: Heya!  You wanna see something cool on the Holonet?
entries.npc_breech_4: Oh, I missed my beloved Tatooine!
entries.npc_backtowork_4: Okay.... when are you planning on bringing her back?
entries.npc_4_5: I don't want to give it away -- but police and the Empire have no reason to arrest Drik Bandrik. There's someone else who does, and Thermal Det can send this evidence straight to that someone. Interested?
entries.npc_4_4: is a woman named Krin Vel. She's been my friend forever. She helped buy me my freedom. I'd never kill her. Will you bring her here safely?
entries.npc_3_5: Oh, bad! I can practically taste my freedom. I'll have to find someone else to make this delivery. Thanks anyway.
entries.npc_3_4: Well, I hope Krin can find her way here alone. She's getting on in years, and the desert is pretty tough.
entries.npc_2_5: Great. Thermal's waiting in the desert, away from Drik's prying spies. If you bring him this datadisc, he'll send it where it will do the most good. Don't worry about Thermal -- he looks weird, but he's a fine fellow.
entries.npc_2_4: That's good. I'll wait here for you. But don't be surprised if Drik sends his thugs to kill you both. He's got a lot riding on this now.
entries.npc_1_5: With the help of my friend Krin, I've assembled evidence that will clear me of all Drik Bandrik's fake charges. I thought of sending it to the police -- but I have a much more clever idea. Will you deliver this disk to my slicer friend, Thermal Det?
entries.npc_1_4: Remember that Bandrik accused me of killing a moisture farmer? Turns out the farmer's not dead. Bandrik paid her to leave town long enough for the lynch mob to do its happy work. I found the farmer. Will you bring her here to me?
entries.notit_5: What's this?  I'm not a junk dealer, okay?
entries.dontknowyou_5: Never mind.  You're not the kind of person I thought you were.
entries.dontknowyou_4: What?  You don't like the blistering heat, the parched air, and the burning suns?  Are you crazy?  This is a paradise!
entries.player_sorry_3: No, the mob leader still breathes.  I will be changing that very soon.
entries.player_sorry_2: Not yet.  I just stopped by to say hello.  I'm off to kill him now.
entries.player_reset_3: I'm sorry.  I just remembered that I'm not a murderer.  You'll have to take care of that yourself.
entries.player_reset_2: I've come back to tell you that I'm not doing this for you anymore.
entries.npc_reset_3: Oh, oh, oh. I don' t know what I'll do now. This is bad!
entries.npc_reset_2: It's one Rodian! But okay, I understand. I sure hope I can find someone to get this assassin before it's too late.
entries.npc_backtowork_3: Ummm... I appreciate your zeal, but all I'm asking is that the mob is prevented from killing me.  But, you're the professional here, I guess.
entries.npc_backtowork_2: I appreciate your kindness.  I would also appreciate if you would be a little more prompt with this too.  It's only my life and all.
entries.npc_breech_3: I don't care whether Kitster's guilty. Drik says he's a troublemaker, and Drik knows best. Get him, guys!
entries.npc_breech_2: Jabba sent me to kill a troublemaker. I'll charge him extra for you!
entries.npc_work_3: Have you killed the leader of the mob?
entries.npc_work_1: Have you destroyed all of those little violent creatures?
entries.cantwork: Hi there. I'm looking for help, so swing back when you're not so busy.
entries.npc_reset_1: Come on, it's just a bunch of Jawas! Oh well, I hope you'll return to help me if you find time.
entries.npc_backtowork_1: Thank you, friend.  Let me know when you've killed them all.
entries.player_sorry_1: No, they're too wily.  I'm still tracking them all down.
entries.player_reset_1: I've changed my mind. I'm actually a bit scared of those little guys.  Sorry.
entries.player_3_3: What's the proof you didn't kill the moisture farmer?
entries.player_3_2: What is the evidence that frames you for the failed slave revolt?
entries.player_2_3: I'm not going to try to stop some mob.  Sorry.
entries.player_2_2: Look, you've got to earn your living somehow.  I can't help you with this.
entries.player_2_1: No.  Jawas are just misunderstood people.
entries.player_1_3: I'll stop them with whatever force is necessary!  Never fear, friend.
entries.player_1_2: Don't worry, Kitster, I'll save you.
entries.player_1_1: I'll take care of those little thieves!
entries.npc_reward_3: You've saved me again, friend! I have a souvenir for you, a droid brain rebuilt by my old friend. He was a real genius mechanic -- once he rebuilt an entire protocol droid. Wonder what he did with that droid?
entries.npc_reward_2: That's a relief. But I need to get Drik Bandrik off my tail before this gets any worse. Worse than Jabba! I can't even think of that. Thanks!
entries.npc_reward_1: That's great news, friend. Drik Bandrik has been busy framing me for other crimes, though, so check back. Meanwhile, here's a souvenir helmet worn by my friend when he won the Grand Arena podraces. Thanks!
entries.npc_4_3: While I was supposedly killing this farmer, I was in fact rotting in an Imperial jail cell -- arrested for
meaning slave rights. They let me go because I was harmless. But I have the arrest record. If you believe me, will you help me clear my name?
entries.npc_4_2: Once I made a speech about slave treatment in the Mos Espa slave market. Drik found a holo of my speech and had a data slicer copy it into the slave quarters at Jabba's palace. Looks like I'm inciting his slaves. But I've never even been to Jabba's palace! Can you help me?
entries.npc_4_1: Years ago I had a friend -- a slave, like I was -- who later left Tatooine and became a great Jedi Knight. He died in the Clone Wars. I own some nice mementos from his podracing days. He won the Boonta Eve Classic! Interested in helping me?
entries.npc_3_3: Oh, oh, oh. I don' t know what I'll do now. This is bad!
entries.npc_3_2: It's one Rodian! But okay, I understand. I sure hope I can find someone to get this assassin before it's too late.
entries.npc_3_1: Come on, it's just a bunch of Jawas! Oh well, I hope you'll return to help me if you find time.
entries.npc_2_3: Thank you! There's six or eight of them, I think -- local moisture farmers led by a big thug named Sont Toipo. If you stop Toipo, the rest will probably run off. I hope. Try not to hurt them, they're just farmers.
entries.npc_2_2: Thanks! The Rodian's named Deeng. He's notorious around here as a thug who would kill his own mother. I think he did, actually. Be careful.
entries.npc_2_1: That's great, friend. These Jawas follow a leader called Wittin. They're not like other Jawas -- they're mean. Be careful. And thanks!
entries.npc_1_3: That slaver Drik Bandrik has framed me again -- this time for killing a moisture farmer. I was nowhere near the murder, and I can prove it. But this local vigilante leader, on Drik's payroll, is leading a mob to lynch me. Please stop them so I can clear my name!
entries.npc_1_2: Bandrik has planted evidence with Jabba the Hutt that frames me for trying to lead a slave revolt at Jabba's palace a few years ago. The revolt failed, but Jabba's still angry. He's sent a Rodian henchman to get me. Can you stop the assassin?
entries.npc_1_1: I've been trying to help Tatooine's slaves get better treatment. This offends a slaver named Drik Bandrik. He framed me for stealing a droid from some Jawas. Turns out these Jawas are violent. They're after me for revenge. Can you stop them?  If you do I'll give you some souvenirs I have...
